title: The county is suing me for medical debt? What should I do?
question: In 2015 i needed to go the emergency room and did not have any medical insurance. Later on I was billed 20,000 dollars. Revenue and Recovery handled the debt and I signed a document at the time being the age I was i did not understand it. I entered into a payment plan. I had paid 600 dollars of it and then fell into financial situation and got behind on payments. 5 days ago I was served with papers and now am getting sued.
answers: There are to many variables to answer your question with any certainty on this forum, I would suggest you sit down with an experienced bankruptcy attorney and discuss your situation. Most bankruptcy attorneys offer a free initial consultation, and they can get all the facts to properly answer your questions.

Bankruptcy may very well be a viable option for you. Do you have any other debt? Your total household income will have to be reviewed as well. Are you making payments on the vehicle? You may want to sit down and have a chat with a local Riverside Bankruptcy attorney. Stuart Steingraber is a very good one in your area. See http://www.stuthelawyer.com/

Your post raises more questions than answers. When you say the age that you were, does that mean you’re under 18? If so, that makes a difference.

I find the idea of an emergency room visit cost and $20,000 to be obscene. I think that from your perspective filing bankruptcy without your husband makes a lot of sense. Sadly, the hospital will pass their loss along to others, but they shouldn’t be charging that kind of money for emergency room visits.

If you find out on your own it will not affect your husband’s credit, so that’s probably your best bet. I would talk to a bankruptcy attorney immediately.
